page.title: 19The Towndweller Part 1.
page.content: In November 1946 a junior reporter came to Pembroke Dock.He married a young lady from the town and has since worked for 20 years on The Guardian and the last 19 years as chief reporter for the Western Telegraph.The biggest change he has seen in his work is that today most people use the phone to supply news whereas he used to walk everywhere to get information.It was his proud boast that in his early days he had been inside almost every house in Pembroke Dock to get a story about one thing or another.For major news items the reporter still has to go out to get his information,very often at short notice to catch the deadline for the newspaper.Only this week there was a serious gas explosion in Haverfordwest only hours before the paper was due to go to press.
